definition[0]: the attitudes and practices that prevent women or particular groups from getting high-level jobs, even though there are no actual laws or rules to stop them
example[0]: Goodhue shattered the glass ceiling as the first female publisher at Time Inc.
definition[1]: the attitudes in an organization that prevent women from rising beyond a certain level, despite having the necessary skills and ability
example[1]: the glass ceiling keeping women executives out of top corporate jobs
example[2]: Women aren’t the only victims of glass walls; it’s an issue that concerns men as well.
